intro: Polygala corifolia, commonly known as the mountain milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing a degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are usually alternate and linear, while its fruit is a legume that contains several seeds. Polygala corifolia is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
